Enchant the Forest

Rite of Accord (Level 4)

Time: 6 hours
Cost: 8 Gnosis (spent on attempt)
Focus: Offerings returned to the land (water, blood, bone, seed, ash, or song)
Participants: One or more Garou
Area: A contiguous natural region with a radius of up to 1 mile

Roll: Gnosis Roll (d20 + Max Gnosis rating)
DC: 17

On Success: The chosen area is enchanted for 30 days. While enchanted: Wyrm-tainted environmental effects are suppressed; natural recovery is accelerated; spirits native to the land are more receptive; attempts to corrupt, desecrate, or spiritually damage the area are made with disadvantage. Does not prevent destruction but resists it.

Limitations: No effect on urban, industrialized, or artificial environments; does not repair structures or undo physical devastation instantly; does not remove creatures; does not stack. ST may require multiple performances if area is under powerful supernatural corruption.

On Failure: Gnosis spent. The land resists the Rite. Local spirits may withdraw or become hostile. Failure does not worsen the land's condition.

description.value:
Enchant the Forest
Rite of Accord • Level 4

Gnosis Cost: 8
Time: 6 hours
Resolution: Gnosis Roll
DC: 17
Participants: One or more Garou
Area: A contiguous natural region with a radius of up to 1 mile
Focus: Offerings returned to the land (water, blood, bone, seed, ash, or song)

Summary

Enchant the Forest is a Rite performed to restore balance and spiritual harmony to a natural place that has been harmed by corruption, neglect, or supernatural imbalance.

This Rite does not rebuild what has been destroyed. It reopens the land to healing.

Effect

On a successful Gnosis roll, the chosen area is enchanted for 30 days.

While the area is enchanted:

  • Wyrm-tainted environmental effects within the area are suppressed
  • Natural recovery within the area is accelerated (plants regrow faster, blight recedes, wildlife returns)
  • Spirits native to the land are more receptive to Garou presence and requests
  • Attempts to corrupt, desecrate, or spiritually damage the area are made with disadvantage

This Rite does not prevent destruction, but it resists it.

Limitations

This Rite:

  • Has no effect on urban, heavily industrialized, or artificial environments
  • Does not repair structures or undo physical devastation instantly
  • Does not remove creatures from the area
  • Does not stack with itself
  • If the area is already under the effect of a powerful supernatural corruption, the Storyteller may require multiple performances over time

Failure

On a failed Gnosis roll:

  • The Gnosis is spent
  • The land resists the Rite
  • Local spirits may withdraw or become hostile
  • Failure does not worsen the land's condition
